rain_amount = lambda m: ["Your plant has had more than enough water for today!", "You need to give your plant {}mm of water"][m<40].format(40-m)
rain_amount=lambda n:n<40 and 'You need to give your plant '+str(40-n)+'mm of water' or 'Your plant has had more than enough water for today!'

def rain_amount(mm):
    if mm < 40:
        a = "You need to give your plant "
        b = "mm of water"
        s = ""
        s += a
        st = 40 - mm
        st = str(st)
        s += st
        s += b
        return s
    else:
         return "Your plant has had more than enough water for today!"
rain_amount = lambda  mm: f'You need to give your plant {40-mm}mm of water' if mm < 40 else 'Your plant has had more than enough water for today!'

def rain_amount(mm):
    return "Your plant has had more than enough water for today!" if mm >= 40 else f'You need to give your plant {40 - mm}mm of water'

def rain_amount(mm):
    return "Your plant has had more than enough water for today!" if mm>40 else "Your plant has had more than enough water for today!" if mm==40 else "You need to give your plant {}mm of water".format(str(40-mm))

def rain_amount(mm):
    return f"You need to give your plant {str(40 - mm)}mm of water"  if mm < 40 else "Your plant has had more than enough water for today!"

def rain_amount(mm):
    return f"You need to give your plant {40-mm}mm of water" if mm < 40 else "Your plant has had more than enough water for today!"
rain_amount = lambda mm: ('Your plant has had more than enough water for today!','You need to give your plant %dmm of water'%(40-mm))[mm<40]

def rain_amount(mm):
    more = "You need to give your plant {amount}mm of water".format(amount = 40 - mm)
    enough = "Your plant has had more than enough water for today!"
    return more if mm < 40 else enough

def rain_amount(mm):
    return ("Your plant has had more "\
            "than enough water for today!",
            "You need to give your plant %d"\
            "mm of water" % (40 - mm))[mm < 40]
